criteria.label: Generic Design & Signatures
criteria.description: Quality of generic function/type design for the toolkit.

levels.label: Weak
levels.description: Signatures are not truly generic or rely on any/unknown. Constraints are missing or incorrect.

levels.label: Okay
levels.description: Generics exist but are slightly awkward, overly constrained, or require manual type parameters at most call sites.

levels.label: Strong
levels.description: Signatures are idiomatic and inference-friendly. Constraints (e.g., K extends keyof T) are correct and useful.

criteria.label: Inference & Developer Experience
criteria.description: How it feels to consume the toolkit from real code.

levels.label: Clumsy
levels.description: Call sites require frequent casting or explicit type parameters; autocomplete is poor.

levels.label: Usable
levels.description: Most call sites work, but some require extra annotations or casts.

levels.label: Smooth
levels.description: Callers get correct types by default. Little to no casting is needed in normal usage.

criteria.label: Correctness & Edge Cases
criteria.description: Behavior of helpers on realistic inputs.

levels.label: Buggy
levels.description: Helpers mishandle common cases (duplicates, empty arrays, simple merges).

levels.label: Mostly correct
levels.description: Core behavior is correct but some edge cases (like no matches or duplicates) are not clearly defined or tested.

levels.label: Robust
levels.description: Helpers behave predictably and tests cover common edge cases such as empty inputs and duplicate IDs.

criteria.label: Tests & Examples
criteria.description: Quality of tests and usage examples.

levels.label: Minimal
levels.description: Few or no tests. No real usage example.

levels.label: Basic
levels.description: Some tests for main helpers. A small example exists but is limited.

levels.label: Good
levels.description: Tests cover multiple helpers and edge cases. A concise example module shows how a real team would use the toolkit.

instructions_to_model: You are reviewing a TypeScript generic collection toolkit for the 'Curator of the Generic Arsenal' boss.
Use the criteria above to score the solution. Focus on generic API design, type inference, correctness, and tests.
For each criterion, pick score 0, 1, or 2 and explain briefly why.
Then compute score_total, score_max, passed based on pass_threshold, integrity as score_total / score_max, and an overall verdict.
zero_guidance.success_summary_hint: Explain why this toolkit would be safe and pleasant to adopt as a shared internal package.
zero_guidance.failure_summary_hint: If it is weak, highlight how to improve generic design, inference, and edge case handling.
